content.question:
Improbe Amor, quid non mortalia pectora cogis!

Ire iterum in lacrimas, iterum temptare precando

cogitur et supplex animos summittere* amori

ne quid inexpertum frustra moritura relinquat.

*also appears as submittere in some texts

1. Name one figure of speech that appears in line 1 and write out the Latin words in which the figure is found.

frqParts.text:
Improbe Amor, quid non mortalia pectora cogis!

Ire iterum in lacrimas, iterum temptare precando

cogitur et supplex animos summittere* amori

ne quid inexpertum frustra moritura relinquat.

*also appears as submittere in some texts

1. Name one figure of speech that appears in line 1 and write out the Latin words in which the figure is found.

2. (a) Who is the subject of cogitur (line 3)?

(b) Identify two of the actions this person is compelled to perform in lines 2-3 (Ire . . . amori), and write out and translate the Latin words or phrases that support your answer.

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
